result.execSummary:
The defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

-No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibitedfrom firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.

-AODA assessment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days condition time in the House of Correction with Huber. Defendant to report by 1/29/2016 by 5:00 pm.

supervisions.notes: Count 1 probation conditions apply except House condition time.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Order signed and filed on 2-23-16.

ORDER:
The defendant's motion or request for release privileges is denied.  The court intended the defendant to serve condition time without release privileges.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for church release.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CMC. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties, Micaela M., and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days condition time in the House of Correction with Huber. Defendant to report by 1/29/2016 by 5:00 pm.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Micaela M.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Crime Victim Impact Statement, Sentencing Referral Form, Three letters on behalf of defendant.

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24 on 6/24/2016 at 1:30 pm.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
All other conditions of bail remain.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. $1,000 cash bail reinstated. All other conditions of bail remain in effect.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State requests an adjournment for victim to be present at sentencing. Court grants state request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears at approximately 11:00 a.m.  Court lifts the bench warrant and ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Attorney Morales notified of this development.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears.  Defendant fails to appear.  Attorney Morales informed that Court that this matter was originally scheduled for January 8, 2016 but changed to today's date.  She believes defendant may have mixed up his court date.  Court issues a warrant but STAYS issuance of the bench warrant until next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Court has a speedy trial ready to go and another court could not be found to take this matter.  As Attorney Wright will be gone for 4 - 5 months, defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court.  Defendant is public defender eligible.  Public Defender's Office will appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Officer Jermaine Graham.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Brushawn Marquell Thomas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
